sentences.text: Time Based Equity Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time to time management recommends and the Compensation Committee approves time based restricted stoc unit awards to certain of our executive officers, typically in connection with the officer joining our company or to ensure tha the officers financial interests are sufficiently aligned with the interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both Mr. Molloy and Mr. Browne were granted time based awards upon joining us in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the amount of these awards, management and the committee considered primarily the executives position and level of responsibility within our company, as well as the retention and long-term incentive value of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lee was also granted a time based award upon his appointment to Chief Digital Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the amount of Mr. Lees award, management and the committee considered his leadership position, the fact that he had not received any prior equity awards since joining the company in early 2015 and the relative importance of equity compensation to executives in the technology and digital sector.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the size of Mr. Lees award, management recommended and the committee agreed that the award should vest in annual installments over a five year period in order to provide the appropriate long-term incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BENEFITS AND PERQUISITES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have no defined benefit pension plan or any type of supplemental retirement plan for executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a deferred compensation plan to provide senior management, including executive officers, with a way to save on a tax deferred basis for retirement and other needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan allows for company contributions in certain limited cases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Nonqualified Deferred Compensation for a description of this plan and the balances under the plan for the named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We did not make any company contributions to the plan in 2016 for any named executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers are eligible to participate in our broad-based benefit plans available to employees generally, including a 401(k) plan and Employee Stock Purchase Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay the premiums for supplemental long-term disability insurance for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The standard benefit offered to all employees provides long-term disability insurance equal to 60% of their salary; however, the benefit is capped at a maximum benefit of $10,000 per month.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cap results in a lower percentage of salary paid for executive officers under the standard benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The supplemental policy brings the total long-term disability insurance benefit for the executive officers closer to the 60% of salary level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the named executive officers, the supplemental policy provides additional monthly disability benefits of approximately $20,000-$30,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To avoid reducing the expected benefit to the executive officers, we also provide a tax gross-up to them to cover the income taxes incurred as a result of our paying the premiums on these policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At Mr. Planks request, we do not provide a tax gross-up to him.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Grant Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, equity awards were granted to executive officers at one of our regularly scheduled Compensation Committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our practice is to grant stock options with an exercise price equal to the closing market price of our common stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have not had any program, plan or practice to select stock option grant dates for executive officers in coordination with the release of material non-public information in order to create value for the executive when the stock price increases over the exercise price for the stock option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hedging and Pledging
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has adopted, as part of our insider trading policy, prohibitions against any employee or director hedging ownership of Under Armour stock by engaging in short sales or purchasing and selling of derivative securities relating to Under Armour stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No director or executive officer of the company has any shares pledged as security.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Severance Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a change in control severance agreement with all of our executives except for our CEO, Mr. Plank.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the agreement is to ensure that we are able to receive and rely upon the executives advice as to the best interest of the company and our stockholders in connection with a change in control without concern that the executive might be distracted, or his or her advice may be affected by the personal uncertainties and risks created by a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreements generally provide severance only following a change in control and only if the executives employment is terminated without cause or the executive leaves for good reason within one year after the change in control, generally referred to as a double trigger.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreements do not provide for a tax gross-up.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary benefit offered under the agreements is severance in an amount equal to one years salary and annual incentive award plus a pro-rata annual incentive award for the year in which the employment ends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive must agree to not compete against the company for one year in order to receive these benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreements have a fixed one-year term with no automatic renewal of the term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In late 2016, the Compensation Committee and the Board reviewed the agreements and a summary prepared by our management on change in control severance benefits offered by other public companies in our line of business, and decided that the agreements were reasonable and should be extended through the end of 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation in excess of $1,000,000.

sentences.text: The limitation applies to such compensation paid in a given year to our CEO and the three other most highly compensated executive officers (excluding the chief financial officer) named in the summary compensation table provided that the executive officer is employed by us as an executive officer as of the end of that year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We intend for awards paid by us pursuant to our annual incentive plan to qualify as performance-based compensation that will not be subject to the limitations on tax deductibility under Section 162(m), although our Compensation Committee reserves the discretion to pay an award outside the plan if it determines that it is in the best interest of the company and our shareholders to do so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tax deductions related to vesting of performance based restricted stock unit awards also generally qualify as performance-based compensation and thus are not subject to these limitations on tax deductibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, with respect to the 2015 performance based restricted stock unit awards, due to the reductions to the adjusted operating income targets described above, these awards are subject to the limitations on tax deductibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reviewing the changes to these awards, our Compensation Committee considered this impact on deductibility and determined it was in the best interest of the company to adjust the performance criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect the impact of this lost tax deduction to be fairly limited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, given that the compensation expense for the 2015 performance based awards is recognized with the vesting of the awards in 2017 through 2019, we do not yet have visibility as to who will be named in the summary compensation table and thus subject to the limitation of deductibility for those years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Plank, our CEO, received performance based stock options and the tax deduction related to the exercise of stock options is not subject to the limitations on tax deductibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, although we are able to record compensation expense for federal income tax purposes for other time based restricted stock awards in the year when the restricted stock award vests, the expense related to these outstanding restricted stock awards will be subject to these limitations on tax deductibility if the executive is subject to these limitations in the year of vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Agreement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of Messrs. Plank, Molloy, Browne or Dickerson had employment agreements as we generally do not have employment agreements with our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of our employment agreements with Messrs. Maurath and Lee are summarized below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Maurath
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company entered into an employment agreement (as required by local law) with Karl-Heinz Maurath in September 2012, with no set term, to serve as President of International.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Maurath was promoted to Chief Revenue Officer in November 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company could terminate the agreement upon two months prior notice or immediately for cause as defined in the agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreement provided that Mr. Mauraths starting base salary would be $400,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the agreement, Mr. Mauraths base salary was subject to merit increases subject to the discretion of the Compensation Committee, and he participated in our annual incentive compensation plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Mauraths agreement further provided for certain equity awards, all of which have vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also received an annual net living allowance of up to $100,000 intended primarily to cover living expenses in Panama, health insurance and a pension fund for him, and participated in other standard benefit programs offered to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: executives of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreement also provided for an annual long-term incentive award at a level at least consistent with annual awards for Executive Vice Presidents at the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreement further provided that he will receive certain severance payments and benefits upon a termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These payments and benefits are described under Potential Payments Upon Termination of Employment or Change in Control below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the agreement, he was subject to obligations regarding confidentiality of company information, protection of the companys intellectual property and non-solicitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because Mr. Mauraths employment agreement was entered into in order to satisfy local law requirements in our Panama office, in connection with Mr. Mauraths transition to our global headquarters in Baltimore Maryland in early 2017, Mr. Mauraths employment agreement was terminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similar to our other U.S.-based executives, we do not expect to have an employment agreement with Mr. Maurath going forward.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with our acquisition of MyFitnessPal in March 2015, the company entered into an employment agreement with Michael Lee in March 2015, with a three year term ending on December 31, 2018, to serve as Senior Vice President, North America Digital and Connected Fitness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lees employment during the three year term and any time period after is on an at-will basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lee was promoted to Chief Digital Officer in July 2016 and became an executive officer at that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreement provided that Mr. Lees starting base salary would be $250,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the agreement, Mr. Lees base salary is subject to merit increases, subject to the discretion of the Compensation Committee, and he participates in our annual incentive compensation plan and is eligible to receive equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreement further provides that if Mr. Lees employment is terminated under certain circumstances during the term of the agreement, he will receive certain severance payments and benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These payments and benefits are described under Potential Payments Upon Termination of Employment or Change in Control below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with entering into his employment agreement, Mr. Lee also entered into an employee confidential information and invention assignment agreement.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee administers the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan allows a select group of management or highly compensated employees as approved by the committee to make annual base salary and annual incentive award deferrals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participating employees may elect to defer from 10% to 75% of their annual base salary and 10% to 90% of their annual incentive award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They generally must make salary deferral elections for a given year by December 31st of the prior year, and incentive award deferral elections for a given year by June 30th of the year for which incentive awards are earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, to defer any 2016 incentive award that might be payable in early 2017, employees must have made an election by June 30, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferral elections cannot be changed or revoked except in very limited hardship circumstances as permitted under applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees immediately vest in all amounts credited to their accounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan includes a make whole feature for employees who, due to participation in the plan, receive a reduction in the matching contribution under our 401(k) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A reduction occurs under the 401(k) plan because of the rule that prohibits the 401(k) plan from recognizing deferrals to a non-qualified plan, such as our deferred compensation plan, in the 401(k) plans definition of compensation for matching contribution purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this plan feature, any amount that, because of these rules, cannot be contributed as a matching contribution to the 401(k) plan will be contributed instead to the deferred compensation plan for those participants employed on the last day of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We make no other contributions to the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We credit the deferred compensation accounts with earnings or losses based on the performance of one or more money market or mutual funds selected by the employee from several investment options offered under the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees may change their investment elections daily.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We contribute to a grantor trust in order to provide us with a source of funds for the benefits payable to participants under the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The assets in the trust are available to provide benefits under the plan unless Under Armour is bankrupt or insolvent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The timing of distributions is based on elections made by the employees at the time of the initial deferral election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees can generally elect to receive a distribution from the plan at least three years after the year in which the deferral amount is actually deferred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees may elect to postpone the distribution date for a minimum of five years if they do so at least one year before the previously specified date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees may also elect to receive a distribution upon retirement in a lump sum or in annual installments over a period of two to ten years, as elected at the time of deferral.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an employee becomes disabled, we pay distributions in a lump sum or in annual installments over a period of two to ten years, as selected by the employee at the time of deferral.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an employee leaves the company, we pay distributions in a lump sum six months following termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an employee dies, we pay distributions in a lump sum to the employees beneficiary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees may not otherwise withdraw amounts from the plan except in the case of an unforeseeable financial emergency as defined in the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have no defined benefit pension plans or supplemental retirement plans for executives.

sentences.text: Definitions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the change in control severance agreements and for the equity awards, the term change in control is generally defined as:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any person or entity becomes the beneficial owner, directly or indirectly, of securities of Under Armour representing 50% or more of the total voting power represented by Under Armours then-outstanding voting securities, except for acquisitions by an Under Armour employee benefit plan or by Kevin A. Plank or his immediate family members;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a change in the composition of our Board occurring within a two-year period, as a result of which fewer than a majority of the directors are incumbent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the consummation of a merger or consolidation of Under Armour with any other corporation, other than a merger or consolidation where our stockholders continue to have at least 50% of the total voting power in substantially the same proportion as prior to such merger or consolidation or where our directors continue to represent at least 50% of the directors of the surviving entity; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the consummation of the sale or disposition by us of all or substantially all of our assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: material misconduct or neglect in the performance of duties;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any felony, an offense punishable by imprisonment, any offense involving material dishonesty, fraud, moral turpitude or immoral conduct, or any crime of sufficient importance to potentially discredit or adversely affect our ability to conduct our business;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: material breach of our code of conduct;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any act that results in severe harm to us, excluding any act in good faith reasonably believed to be in our best interests; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: material breach of the agreement and the related confidentiality, non-competition and non-solicitation agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the change in control severance agreements and for the equity awards, the term good reason is generally defined :
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a diminishment in the scope of duties or responsibilities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a reduction in base salary, bonus opportunity or a material reduction in the aggregate benefits or perquisites;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: relocation more than 50 miles from the executives primary place of business, or a significant increase in required travel;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a failure by any successor to Under Armour to assume the change in control severance agreement; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a material breach by us of any of the terms of the change in control severance agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits and Payments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For awards granted prior to 2014, restricted stock units and performance based restricted stock units vest upon a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts reflect the value of such restricted stock units and performance based restricted stock units on December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Outstanding Equity Awards at 2016 Fiscal Year-End table for the equity awards that vest upon a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For awards granted beginning in 2014, all restricted stock units, performance based restricted stock units and performance based stock options require a double trigger for vesting in connection with a change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double-trigger vesting requires both a change of control and a termination of the award holders employment without Cause or resignation by the executive for Good Reason in connection with that change of control for the vesting of unvested equity awards to accelerate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For any performance based restricted stock unit or performance based stock option awards for which the performance period is not complete, the number of shares or options at the target level of performance would be accelerated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon termination of employment without Cause or by Executive for Good Reason in connection with a Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the change in control severance agreements, if the executives employment is terminated without Cause or by the executive for Good Reason in connection with a change in control, the executive would receive:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: accrued but unpaid salary and vacation pay (no amounts assumed because salary is paid every two weeks and unused vacation days do not carry over from year to year, making payments unlikely or insignificant);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a pro-rata bonus for the year in which the change in control occurs at the higher of the average bonus paid in th two years prior to termination of employment or the target bonus for the year of such termination of employment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump sum payment equal to the sum of (1) the annual base salary of the executive at the highest rate in effect during the twelve month period following the change in control and (2) the higher of the average bonus paid in the two years prior to termination of employment or the target bonus for the year of such termination of employment; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: for a period of up to one year after the date of termination, continuation of certain medical, life insurance and other welfare benefits unless the executive becomes eligible for another employers benefits that are substantially similar.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a condition to the receipt of the lump sum payment and the continuation of benefits described above, the executive will be required to sign or reconfirm a confidentiality agreement and a one-year non-competition and non-solicitation agreement and execute a general release of claims against Under Armour and its affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon termination of employment for any other reason in connection with a Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the change in control severance agreements, if the executives employment is terminated for any other reason, he executive is entitled to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: accrued but unpaid salary and vacation pay (no amounts assumed because salary is paid every two weeks and unused vacation days do not carry over from year to year, making payments unlikely or insignificant); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a pro-rata bonus for the year in which the change in control occurs (assumed in this case to be the target bonus).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination of employment without Cause
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event the company terminates Mr. Mauraths employment without Cause he would receive his salary for one year and a pro-rata bonus for the year he was terminated (assumed in this case to be the target bonus).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination of employment without Cause or by Executive for Good Reason
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event the company terminated Mr. Lees employment without cause or he resigned for good reason on December 31, 2016, he would receive two times his base salary and a pro-rata bonus for the year he was terminated (assumed in this case to be the target bonus).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of Mr. Lees employment agreement, in addition to the items described under the definition of Cause above, the term is further defined to include a material breach of any material provision of Mr. Lees employment agreement or any other agreement to which he is a party with us, his willful failure to perform his duties under his employment agreement, his willful failure to follow a lawful directive of our Board of Directors and his material failure to comply with our material written policies or rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination of employment for any reason with Under Armour enforcing a non-compete
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives generally may not compete for one year after termination of employment for any reason if we continue to pay 60% of their salary during this period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Maurath is not subject to this agreement due to limitations under local law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lee is also not subject to this agreement due to limitations under state law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Disability
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All restricted stock units, performance based restricted stock units and stock options vest upon the executives disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The named executive officers are covered by a supplemental long-term disability insurance policy that provides an additional benefit beyond the standard benefit offered to employees generally (standard benefit is up to $10,000 monthly).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If executives had become disabled, they would have received monthly supplemental disability insurance payments of $20,000 until age 65 (or $19,453 in the case of Mr. Lee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Maurath is covered by a separate disability insurance policy that pays monthly disability insurance payments of $30,000 until age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Monthly disability payments are not included in the above table because they are paid under a disability insurance policy and not by us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, under his employment agreement, if Mr. Maurath becomes disabled he continues to receive his salary for one year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Death
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All restricted stock units, performance based restricted stock units and stock options vest upon the executives death

sentences.text: ADVISORY APPROVAL OF OUR EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide stockholders with the opportunity to cast an annual advisory vote on executive compensation (commonly referred to as a say on pay proposal).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vote is on whether to approve the compensation of the named executive officers as disclosed in the Executive Compensation section of this Proxy Statement, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and the related narrative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, 99% of the votes cast on the say on pay proposal voted in favor of our executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes the results of the 2016 say on pay vote demonstrated that stockholders generally agreed with our compensation program and policies and the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While this advisory vote to approve executive compensation is non-binding, the Board and the Compensation Committee will review the voting results and seek to determine the cause or causes of any significant negative voting result.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting results provide little detail by themselves, and we may consult directly with stockholders to better understand issues and concerns not previously presented.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and management understand that it is useful and appropriate to seek the views of stockholders when considering the design and implementation of executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors asks you to consider the following statement: Do you approve our executive compensation as described in the Executive Compensation section of this Proxy Statement, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and other narrative executive compensation disclosures?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approval of our executive compensation as described in the Executive Compensation section of this Proxy Statement, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and other narrative executive compensation disclosures, requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR the approval of our executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF FUTURE ADVISORY VOTES ON OUR EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION (PROPOSAL 3)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in Proposal No. 2 above, the Companys stockholders are being provided the opportunity to cast an advisory vote on our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The advisory vote on our executive compensation described in Proposal No. 2 above is referred to as a say on pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act requires all publicly-traded companies to provide stockholders the opportunity to cast an advisory, non-binding vote on how often we should include a say on pay vote in our proxy materials for future annual shareholder meetings (or special shareholder meeting for which the company must include executive compensation information in the proxy statement for that meeting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this Proposal No. 3, stockholders may vote to have the say on pay vote every one year, every two years or every three years or abstain from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that say on pay votes should be conducted every year so that stockholders may annually express their views on our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, which administers our executive compensation program, values the opinions expressed by stockholders in these votes and will consider the outcome of these votes in making its decisions on our executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote to hold say on pay votes every ONE YEAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TRANSACTIONS WITH RELATED PERSONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kevin Plank, our Chairman and CEO, has personally invested in certain commercial revitalization efforts in Baltimore, Maryland, where our corporate headquarters is located.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, from time to time we have entered into related party transactions with him that were in the companys interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Armour Corporate Offices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2014 we entered into a lease agreement with an entity controlled by Mr. Plank to lease office space in a building located near our corporate headquarters in Baltimore, Maryland.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lease had a 10 year term beginning in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our total lease payments to Mr. Planks company were approximately $0.7 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following a third party appraisal, we determined the lease payments were at or below fair market lease rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also determined that the location of the property as well as other favorable terms of the lease, such as renewal options and the right to occupy certain additional space without increased lease payments, provided us with overall terms that were both fair and reasonable to us and provided flexibility otherwise unavailable at alternative locations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This lease was terminated without penalty upon our acquisition of the underlying property as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the entry into this lease agreement, we determined that we would realize greater benefits by acquiring the parcel that includes the office building as well as surrounding parcels in order to further expand our corporate headquarters to accommodate our growth needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The location and size of the undeveloped parcels in close proximity to our current corporate headquarters provided us with a unique opportunity to develop a global headquarters suited to our needs and corporate culture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We engaged an independent third-party to appraise the fair market value of the parcels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee engaged its own independent appraisal firm to assess the parcels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2016 we entered into a Purchase Agreement with entities controlled by Mr. Plank to acquire these parcels for a purchase price of $70.3 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We determined that the purchase price for these parcels represented the fair market value of the parcels and approximated the cost to the seller to purchase and develop the parcels, including costs related to the termination of a lease encumbering the property.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the purchase, in September 2016, the parties also entered into an agreement pursuant to which the parties will share the burden of any special taxes arising due to infrastructure projects in the surrounding area.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The allocation to us is based on the expected benefits to our parcels from these projects.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No obligations are currently owed by either party under this agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee determined that the terms of the purchase were reasonable and fair and that we would realize significant benefits from the flexibility and certainty purchasing the parcels will provide us with respect to our ongoing campus growth needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015 we also entered into a lease with an entity controlled by Mr. Plank to lease industrial space located near our corporate headquarters in Baltimore, which we use as an innovation and manufacturing testing facility and for other business purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the locations proximity to our headquarters in Baltimore City, the use of this space provided a unique opportunity for us to build a state-of-the-art facility able to accommodate our innovation needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lease covers 68,000 square feet and has a five year term, with payments beginning in April 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual lease rate is currently $510,000, with the annual lease rate escalating 2.5% each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, our total lease payments were approximately $0.4 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following an independent market rent appraisal, we determined that the lease payments were below fair market lease rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also determined that the location of the property as well as other favorable terms of the lease, such as renewal options and flexibility regarding the design of the space, provide us with overall terms that were both fair and reasonable to us and provided flexibility otherwise unavailable at alternative locations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aircraft
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A company owned by Mr. Plank owns a jet aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have an operating lease agreement with the company to lease the aircraft when it is used by Mr. Plank or other persons for our business purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay a fixed monthly lease payment of $166,667 under the terms of the lease agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, a company owned by Mr. Plank owns a helicopter aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2016 we entered into a lease agreement with the company to lease the helicopter when it is used by Mr. Plank or other persons for our business purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay an hourly lease rate of $6,500 under the terms of the lease agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our total lease amounts for 2016 with respect to these aircrafts were $2.4 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to each of these aircraft, we determined that the lease payment rates are at or below the fair market value lease rate for these aircraft based on third party appraisals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee determined these lease terms were reasonable and that we would benefit by the use of each of the aircraft for company business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hotel
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In March 2017, entities controlled by Mr. Plank and his brother Scott Plank opened a hotel located in Baltimore, Maryland.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The hotel is operated by a third party management company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We anticipate utilizing this hotel from time to time for Under Armour business purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have negotiated corporate rate discounts for use of the hotel with the management company, consistent with rates otherwise available for comparable hotels in the area.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee approved the terms of each of the foregoing transactions in accordance with our policy on transactions with related persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policies and Procedures for Review and Approval of Transactions with Related Persons
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines require that any transaction involving Under Armour and a director or executive officer or entities controlled by a director or executive officer, be approved by our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has delegated to the Audit Committee oversight and approval of these and other matters that may present conflicts of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee has adopted a formal written policy on transactions with related persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related persons are generally defined under SEC rules as our directors, executive officers, or stockholders owning at least five percent of our outstanding shares, or immediate family members of any of the foregoing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy provides that the committee shall review and approve or ratify transactions with related persons and any material changes to such transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy further provides that in determining whether to approve or ratify such a transaction, the committee may consider the following factors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether the terms of the transaction are reasonable and fair to Under Armour and on the same basis as would apply if the transaction did not involve a related person;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether the transaction would impair the independence of a non-management director; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether the transaction would present an improper conflict of interest, taking into account the size of the transaction, the materiality of a related persons direct or indirect interest in the transaction, and any other factors the committee deems relevant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent our employment of an immediate family member of a director, executive officer or five percent stockholder is considered a transaction with a related person, the policy provides that the committee will not be required to ratify or approve such employment if the executive officer, director or five percent stockholder does not participate in decisions regarding the hiring, performance evaluation, or compensation of the family member.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment of Related Parties
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain immediate family members of our directors and executive officers are employees of Under Armour.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For these purposes, an immediate family member includes any spouse, parent, stepparent, child, stepchild, sibling, mother or father-in-law, son or daughter-in-law, and brother or sister-in-law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only one immediate family member was employed by us in 2016 with compensation exceeding $120,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Albert Lee serves as our Vice President of Digital Product and is the brother of Michael Lee, our Chief Digital Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Albert Lee received total cash compensation of $489,038 (including 2016 salary and bonus paid in early 2017), and also received restricted stock unit awards with a grant date fair value of $10.2 million, which were recommended by our CEO and approved by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because Albert Lee reports directly to Michael Lee, the Audit Committee reviewed and approved Albert Lees compensation in accordance with our policy on transactions with related persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INDEPENDENT AUDITORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has selected PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, or PwC, to continue as our independent registered public accounting firm for the year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of PwC are expected to attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They will have an opportunity to make a statement if they so desire and they will respond to appropriate questions from stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fees billed by PwC for 2016 and 2015 for services rendered to Under Armour were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016     2015   Audit Fees    $2,180,806    $2,018,113  Audit-Related Fees      0      37,383  Tax Fees      249,500      205,728  All Other Fees      4,140      4,500
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Fees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit fees are for the audit of our annual consolidated financial statements and our internal control over financial reporting, for reviews of our quarterly financial statements and for services that are normally provided by the independent registered public accounting firm in connection with statutory and regulatory filings or engagements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit-Related Fees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When paid, audit-related fees generally are for assurance and related services that are reasonably related to the performance of the audit or review of our consolidated financial statements and are not included under Audit Fees above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2015, audit-related fees consisted of compliance services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Fees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When paid, tax fees generally are for tax planning and tax advice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2015 and 2016, tax fees primarily included assistance with tax credit reviews and consulting on customs valuations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, for 2016 tax fees also included assistance with value-added tax consulting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Other Fees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All other fees relate to a subscription to an accounting research tool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pre-Approval Policies and Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As set forth in the Audit Committees Charter, the Audit Committee approves in advance all services to be performed by our independent registered public accounting firm, including all audit and permissible non-audit services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee has adopted a written policy for such approvals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy provides that the committee must specifically pre-approve the terms of the annual audit services engagement and may pre-approve, for up to one year in advance, particular types of permissible audit-related, tax and other non-audit services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy also provides that the services shall be described in sufficient detail as to the scope of services, fee and fee structure, and the impact on auditor independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy states that, in exercising its pre-approval authority, the committee may consider whether the independent registered public accounting firm is best positioned to provide the most effective and efficient service, for reasons such as familiarity with our business, people, culture, accounting systems, risk profiles and other factors, and whether the service might enhance our ability
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: to manage or control risk or improve audit quality.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy also provides that the committee should be mindful of the relationship between fees for audit and non-audit services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the policy, the committee may delegate pre-approval authority to one or more of its members and any pre-approval decisions will be reported to the full committee at its next scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee has delegated this pre-approval authority to the Chairman of the committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AUDIT COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The role of the Audit Committee is oversight of matters relating to accounting, internal control, auditing, financial reporting, risk and legal and regulatory compliance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee oversees the audit and other services of our independent registered public accounting firm and is directly responsible for the appointment, independence, qualifications, compensation and oversight of the independent registered public accounting firm, which reports directly to the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our management is responsible for the financial reporting process and preparation of quarterly and annual consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our independent registered public accounting firm is responsible for conducting audits and reviews of our consolidated financial statements and audits of our internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has reviewed and discussed our 2016 audited consolidated financial statements with management and with our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also has discussed with the independent registered public accounting firm the matters required to be discussed by applicable auditing guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also has received the written disclosures and the letter from our independent registered public accounting firm required by applicable requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board regarding the independent registered public accounting firms communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence, and has discussed with the independent registered public accounting firm its independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the review and discussions referred to above and subject to the limitations on its role and responsibilities, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board that the 2016 audited consolidated financial statements be included in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016 to be filed with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors approved this recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A.B. Krongard, Chairman Douglas E. Coltharp          Anthony W. Deering
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RATIFICATION OF APPOINTMENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM (PROPOSAL 4)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the rules and regulations of the SEC, the Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment of our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has appointed PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, or PwC, as our independent registered public accounting firm to audit our consolidated financial statements and our internal control over financial reporting for the year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PwC has served as our independent auditors since 2003.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The services provided to us by PwC, along with the corresponding fees for 2016 and 2015, are described under the caption Independent Auditors in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder ratification of the appointment of the independent registered public accounting firm is not required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking stockholders to ratify the appointment because we believe it is a sound corporate governance practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If our stockholders do not ratify the selection, the Audit Committee will consider whether or not to retain PwC, but may still retain them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ratification of the appointment of the independent registered public accounting firm requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR the ratification of the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 16(a) BENEFICIAL OWNERSHIP REPORTING COMPLIANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 requires our executive officers, directors and persons who own more than 10% of a registered class of our securities, to file initial reports of ownership of our stock and reports of changes n such ownership with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To our knowledge, based solely on a review of the copies of such reports furnished to us and written representations from our executive officers, directors and greater than 10% stockholders, all required filings pursuant to Section 16(a) were timely made during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STOCKHOLDER PROPOSALS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder proposals to be included in our Proxy Statement pursuant to SEC rule 14a-8 for our 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders must be received by the Secretary of Under Armour on or before December 14, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders wishing to submit a proposal (including a nomination for election as a director) for consideration at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, but which will not be included in the Proxy Statement for such meeting, must do so in accordance with the terms of the advance notice provisions in our bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These advance notice provisions require that among other things, the stockholder give timely written notice to the Secretary of Under Armour not less than 90 days nor more than 150 days prior to the first anniversary of the date of the mailing of the notice of the previous years Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, a stockholders notice of a proposal will be considered timely if received no earlier than November 19, 2017 and no later than January 18, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if we delay or advance mailing notice of the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders by more than 30 days from the date of the first anniversary of the 2017 notice mailing, then such stockholder notice of proposal must be delivered to the Secretary of Under Armour not less than 90 days nor more than 150 days prior to the date of mailing of the notice for the 2018 Annual Meeting (or by the tenth day following the day on which we disclose the mailing date of notice for the 2018 Annual Meeting, if that date is later).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appendix A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RECONCILIATION OF NON-GAAP FINANCIAL MEASURES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement refers to adjusted operating income, which is considered a non-GAAP financial measure, as defined by SEC Regulation G. We have provided below a reconciliation of this measure to the most directly comparable financial measure calculated in accordance with GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this non-GAAP financial measure may be useful in evaluating our financial information and comparing year-over-year performance, and we have incorporated this measure into certain of our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, it should not be considered in isolation and should be viewed in addition to, and not as an alternative for, our reported results prepared in accordance with GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our non-GAAP financial information may not be comparable to similarly titled measures reported by other companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this Proxy Statement, we define adjusted operating income as our reported income from operations, excluding the impact of non-capitalized deal costs and the amortization of intangible assets related to any acquisition completed in 2015 or 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table provides a numerical reconciliation of adjusted operating income:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Income from Operations (GAAP)         Adjustments  Acquisition Related         Adjusted Operating Income (Non-GAAP)       Combined Fiscal Years Ended December 31, 2015 and 2016        $  826.0 million      $  19.9 million           $   845.9 million
